University of York student housing rent prices soar by a 27 percent average

11/02/2023

Nouse covers the increase in rental prices across popular York student housing areas

Image by ALANAH HAMMOND

By Alanah Hammond

In a recent survey of 30 students,Â Nouse has found that the rentÂ prices in York for student houses areÂ increasing by an average of 27 percentÂ for the 2023/24 academic year in com-parison to the 2022/23 academic year.

The data collected reflects studentÂ houses in York, which have their billsÂ included, in popular student areas suchÂ as Badger Hill, Tang Hall and houses inÂ the vicinity of Hull Road. The data alsoÂ reflect rental prices for the same houseÂ in the next academic year.

The survey found that the highestÂ rent increase was a 42 percent increaseÂ which was for a student property located off of Hull Road.

NouseÂ spoke to second year History student Ellie Cape who currentlyÂ lives in this property where rent hasÂ increased exponentially. Ellie explainedÂ her thoughts on the current studentÂ housing crisis stating, â€œI think theÂ prices are extortionate for what weâ€™reÂ paying for and when you compare it toÂ other university houses in other citiesÂ you realise how overpriced they are. In particular, Kayla Vicente, a firstÂ year Theatre student, drew attentionÂ to the rent increase in popular studentÂ area Badger Hill. This uplift falls well short of theÂ current rate of inflation, which stands atÂ 10.7 percent. Added with rent increasesÂ averaging 27 percent, it is clear that students will suffer.

With so many student grievances,Â Nouse also wanted to hear the perspective of Yorkâ€™s renting crisis from a localÂ landlord. They wished to remain anonymous, but they own several York student properties and have been a land-lord for over three decades.

This has the effect ofÂ capping the available supply of sharedÂ housing.
